The Qualifying Variant (QV) Database offers an open, shareable, and reproducible framework for genomic interpretation. Central to this framework are the QV criteria YAML files, which define specific genomic variant criteria used within analysis pipelines. These files provide structured, machine-readable definitions that standardise how variants are selected and interpreted across different genomic studies, ensuring consistency and reproducibility in genetic analysis. Demonstrated effectively in our validation case studies, these files facilitate streamlined and accurate variant interpretation, critical for both research and clinical diagnostics. FAIR data is data which meets the FAIR principles of findability, accessibility, interoperability, and reusability (Wilkinson et al 2016).

Build or submit a public QV file

Open QV builder » Open submission form »

Submissions will be reviewed before publication. We recommend the YAML layout for its human and machine readable format. This simple key value pair structure makes your data easy to understand and process. Submissions in other suitable formats are also accepted.
